pr_title: Fix issues found from a development smoke test

timeline.message: Fix(Java): Fix task name logging and project-version notification url
Fix(Java): Update message parser to exclude links in top level deletes
Fix(Java): Change the way to get tasks by class name to use isAssignable
Fix(Java): Include the project url in project deleted messages

timeline.body:
Why not add `@Nullable`, javax.annotation.Nullable, to the nullableTopLevelAction?

``` java
public String getCommonTopic(MessageContentGroup messageContent, @Nullable ItemOperation nullableTopLevelAction) {
```

timeline.author: jamesrichard91

replies.bodyText: We don't have a standardized use of this and even if it is null, it is used in a null-safe way.

replies.bodyText: Or the return type should be Optional<ItemOperation>

timeline.body: By removing the default "-1" aren't you opening this up to possible NPE's?
timeline.bodyText: By removing the default "-1" aren't you opening this up to possible NPE's?
timeline.bodyHTML: By removing the default "-1" aren't you opening this up to possible NPE's?
timeline.author: jamesrichard91

replies.bodyText: There is no way for this config to be deleted without the id, so it will always be present or error out before it gets here.
replies.author: gkillough

timeline.body: When should we use the ternary operator vs something like this?
timeline.bodyText: When should we use the ternary operator vs something like this?
timeline.bodyHTML: When should we use the ternary operator vs something like this?
timeline.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: This is gonna sound weird, but I think a "three dot" maximum should be the rule of thumb. If dereferencing is happening more than three times, it should not be part of a ternary operation.
replies.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: That goes for the calling class as well, think of method calls as this.doSomething().
replies.author: gkillough

timeline.body: Another possible location for ternary operator
timeline.bodyText: Another possible location for ternary operator
timeline.bodyHTML: Another possible location for ternary operator
timeline.author: bamandel

timeline.message: Fix(Java): Return Optional rather than null and fix test errors
